uniqueRequirements: Applicants under 18 can take the Class E Knowledge Exam online
Applicants under 18 must complete the 6-hour Driver Education Traffic Safety (DETS) course (replaced TLSAE in Aug 2025)
Permit holders must be accompanied by a licensed driver 21+ in the front passenger seat
For the first 3 months, driving is restricted to daylight hours only; after 3 months, until 10 PM

questions.questionText: If you are a licensed driver aged 16, you may not drive between ___ unless accompanied by a licensed driver age 21 or older.
questions.explanation: A 16-year-old licensed driver may not drive between 11:00 PM and 6:00 AM unless driving to or from work or accompanied by a licensed driver 21 years of age or older.

questions.questionText: Under Florida's 'Move Over' law, if you approach an emergency vehicle stopped with lights flashing on a two-lane road, you must:

answers.text: Move to the opposite lane immediately
Slow down to a speed that is 20 mph less than the posted speed limit
Maintain your speed but stay alert
Stop until the emergency vehicle leaves

questions.explanation: On a two-lane road where you cannot move over, you must slow to a speed that is 20 mph less than the posted speed limit. If the speed limit is 20 mph or less, you must travel at 5 mph.

questions.questionText: Any driver under 21 years of age who is stopped by law enforcement and has a blood alcohol level of ___ or higher will automatically have their driving privilege suspended for one year.
questions.explanation: Florida has a Zero Tolerance policy. Any driver under 21 with a breath or blood alcohol level of 0.02% or higher will have their license suspended for one year.

questions.questionText: The standard speed limit in a residential or business district in Florida, unless otherwise posted, is:
questions.explanation: Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit in municipal speed areas, business, or residential districts is 30 mph.

questions.questionText: The speed limit in a school zone in Florida is typically:
questions.explanation: The standard speed limit for school zones in Florida is 20 mph.

questions.questionText: When you are approaching a bicyclist from the rear, you must give them a minimum clearance of:
questions.explanation: Florida law requires drivers to give bicyclists a minimum of 3 feet of clearance when passing.

questions.questionText: You are required to turn on your headlights:

answers.text: From sunset to sunrise, and whenever visibility is reduced
Whenever you are on a highway

questions.explanation: You must use headlights between sunset and sunrise, and during rain, smoke, or fog.

questions.questionText: If a school bus stops to unload children on a divided highway with a raised barrier of at least 5 feet:

answers.text: Vehicles traveling in the opposite direction must stop
Vehicles traveling in the opposite direction do not have to stop
All vehicles on both sides must stop
Vehicles behind the bus can pass if safe

questions.explanation: If a raised barrier or an unpaved median at least 5 feet wide divides the highway, vehicles traveling in the opposite direction are not required to stop.

questions.questionText: Texting while driving in Florida is:
questions.explanation: Texting while driving is illegal and is a primary offense in Florida, meaning an officer can pull you over specifically for that violation.

questions.questionText: If you are involved in a crash that results in property damage of ___ or more, you must report it to the police.
questions.explanation: Crashes involving injury, death, or property damage of at least $500 must be reported to law enforcement immediately.

questions.questionText: What are the driving restrictions for a 17-year-old with a Class E license?

answers.text: No driving between 11 PM and 6 AM
No driving between 1 AM and 5 AM unless for work or supervised

questions.explanation: A 17-year-old licensed driver may not drive between 1:00 AM and 5:00 AM unless driving to/from work or accompanied by a licensed driver over 21.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to use ___ while driving a motor vehicle.
questions.explanation: It is illegal to wear a headset, headphone, or other listening device, other than a hearing aid, while driving.

questions.questionText: Who is required to wear a seat belt in Florida?

answers.text: The driver, front-seat passengers, and all passengers under 18

questions.explanation: The driver, front seat passengers, and all passengers under the age of 18 must wear a seat belt.

questions.questionText: Children under the age of ___ must be secured in a federally approved child-restraint seat.
questions.explanation: Children aged 5 and under must be secured in a federally approved child restraint device. Children 0-3 must be in a carrier/seat; aged 4-5 can use a seat or booster.

questions.questionText: If you refuse to take a breath test when asked by an officer (Implied Consent Law), your license will be suspended for:
questions.explanation: Refusal to submit to a breath, urine, or blood test results in a mandatory one-year license suspension for a first offense.

questions.questionText: When driving in rain, the road is most slippery:

answers.text: After it has rained for an hour

questions.explanation: Roads are most slippery just after rain begins because the oil and grease on the pavement mix with the water.

questions.questionText: The safe following distance for normal driving conditions in Florida is:
questions.explanation: Florida recommends a minimum following distance of 4 seconds during normal weather and traffic conditions.

questions.questionText: If your vehicle breaks down on the highway, you should:

answers.text: Stop in the middle of the lane
Move completely off the pavement and turn on hazard flashers
Stand behind your car to warn traffic
Leave the car and walk for help immediately

questions.explanation: If your vehicle breaks down, move it completely off the pavement if possible and turn on your emergency flashers.

questions.questionText: When entering an expressway (interstate), you should:

answers.text: Stop at the end of the ramp
Use the acceleration lane to build up speed to match traffic
Drive slowly until you find a gap
Honk to let others know you are entering

questions.explanation: Use the acceleration lane to increase your speed to match the flow of traffic before merging.

questions.questionText: If you drive past your exit on an interstate highway:

answers.text: Make a U-turn at the nearest median crossing
Stop and wait for a gap in traffic

questions.explanation: Never back up or make a U-turn on an interstate. If you miss your exit, you must proceed to the next one.

questions.questionText: High beam headlights can reveal objects up to a distance of:
questions.explanation: High beam headlights can reveal objects up to 450 feet away. Low beams are effective for about 150 feet.

questions.questionText: You must lower your high beam headlights when approaching an oncoming vehicle within:
questions.explanation: You must dim your high beams within 500 feet of an oncoming vehicle.

questions.questionText: If your gas pedal sticks, you should:

answers.text: Try to unstick it with your foot while looking down

questions.explanation: If the gas pedal jams, tap it to free it. If that fails, shift into Neutral, steer to a safe place, and then turn off the engine.

questions.questionText: A defensive driver should check their rearview mirror approximately every:
questions.explanation: Check your mirrors every 10 seconds or so to be aware of traffic behind you.

questions.questionText: When sharing the road with a large truck, you should avoid:
questions.explanation: Large trucks have large blind spots called 'No Zones' on the front, back, and sides. Avoid driving in these areas.

questions.questionText: If you are driving and a tire blows out, you should:

answers.text: Grip the steering wheel firmly and take your foot off the gas

questions.explanation: Do not brake. Grip the wheel firmly, ease off the gas, and keep the car going straight until it slows down enough to pull over.

questions.questionText: At a four-way stop, if two cars arrive at the same time, who yields?

answers.text: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left
The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right
The driver going straight yields to the driver turning

questions.explanation: At a four-way stop, if vehicles arrive simultaneously, the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.

questions.questionText: When entering a public road from a private driveway or alley, you must:

answers.text: Yield to all approaching traffic and pedestrians
Only yield to cars, not pedestrians
Drive out slowly to block traffic

questions.explanation: You must yield the right-of-way to all vehicles and pedestrians on the roadway you are entering.

questions.questionText: You are approaching an intersection with a green light, but traffic is blocking the intersection. You should:

answers.text: Stay out of the intersection until traffic clears
Honk at the cars blocking you

questions.explanation: Do not enter an intersection unless you can clear it completely. Blocking an intersection is illegal (often called 'blocking the box').

questions.questionText: When turning left at an intersection, you must yield to:

answers.text: No one if the light is green
Traffic on the cross street only

questions.explanation: When making a left turn, you must yield right-of-way to any oncoming vehicles and pedestrians crossing your path.

questions.questionText: If a traffic signal is out of order (not working), you should treat the intersection as:
questions.explanation: If a traffic signal is inoperative, treat the intersection as a four-way stop.

questions.questionText: Pedestrians have the right-of-way:

answers.text: Only when they have a 'Walk' signal
At all times in a crosswalk (marked or unmarked) and intersections
Only if they are wearing bright clothing

questions.explanation: Drivers must yield to pedestrians crossing the street or driveway at any marked or unmarked crosswalk at an intersection.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to park within ___ feet of a fire hydrant.
questions.explanation: Parking is prohibited within 15 feet of a fire hydrant.

questions.questionText: When parking downhill with a curb, you should turn your wheels:
questions.explanation: When parking downhill with a curb, turn your wheels toward the curb so the vehicle will roll into the curb if the brakes fail.

questions.questionText: You cannot park within ___ feet of a railroad crossing.
questions.explanation: It is illegal to park within 50 feet of a railroad crossing.

questions.questionText: Before leaving your parked vehicle, you must always:

answers.text: Set the parking brake and take the keys

questions.explanation: Always set the parking brake, stop the engine, and take your keys with you when leaving your vehicle.

questions.questionText: Parking is not allowed within ___ feet of an intersection.
questions.explanation: You must not park within 20 feet of an intersection.

questions.questionText: A red octagonal sign always means:
questions.explanation: The octagon (8-sided) shape is exclusively used for Stop signs.

questions.questionText: A triangular sign pointing down means:
questions.explanation: The inverted triangle is exclusively used for Yield signs.

questions.questionText: A diamond-shaped yellow sign is a:
questions.explanation: Yellow diamond-shaped signs are warning signs alerting you to hazards or road conditions ahead.

questions.questionText: An orange sign typically indicates:
questions.explanation: Orange signs are used for construction and maintenance warning.

questions.questionText: A pentagon (5-sided) sign marks:

answers.text: A school zone or school crossing

questions.explanation: The pentagon shape is reserved for school zones and school crossings.

questions.questionText: A pennant-shaped yellow sign on the left side of the road indicates:
questions.explanation: The pennant (flag) shape is used exclusively to mark the beginning of a No Passing Zone.

questions.questionText: A round yellow sign with an 'X' and 'RR' means:
questions.explanation: Circular yellow signs warn of an upcoming railroad crossing.

questions.questionText: Green road signs are used for:
questions.explanation: Green signs provide guidance, such as distances, directions, and exit numbers.

questions.questionText: Blue road signs indicate:
questions.explanation: Blue signs guide motorists to services like gas, food, lodging, and hospitals.

questions.questionText: A sign with a red circle and a slash through it means:
questions.explanation: The red circle with a slash is the universal symbol for 'No' or 'Prohibited'.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a 'plus' (+) sign indicates:
questions.explanation: A cross symbol (+) on a warning sign indicates a four-way intersection (crossroad) ahead.

questions.questionText: A sign with two arrows pointing down and away from a divider indicates:

answers.text: Traffic flows to both sides of the divider

questions.explanation: This sign is often placed at the beginning of an island or obstruction, meaning traffic can pass on either side.

questions.questionText: A sign showing a car with 'squiggly' lines behind it means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns that the road surface becomes slippery when wet. Slow down.

questions.questionText: In Florida, the Financial Responsibility Law requires drivers to carry at least ___ in Personal Injury Protection (PIP) coverage.
questions.explanation: Florida law requires owners to carry a minimum of $10,000 in Personal Injury Protection (PIP) and $10,000 in Property Damage Liability (PDL).

questions.questionText: If you accumulate 12 points on your driving record within 12 months, your license will be suspended for:
questions.explanation: The suspension period for 12 points in 12 months is 30 days.

questions.questionText: You are approaching a drawbridge that has a red light and a gate that is lowering. You must:

answers.text: Stop at the marked stop line
Slow down and watch for the bridge tender

questions.explanation: Drivers must stop at the marked stop line when drawbridge signals are red or the gate is lowering.

questions.questionText: When checking your blind spots before changing lanes, you should:

answers.text: Turn your head and look over your shoulder
Lean forward to look in the mirror

questions.explanation: Mirrors leave blind spots. You must physically turn your head to check over your shoulder.

questions.questionText: A first conviction for DUI (Driving Under the Influence) can result in a fine of up to:
questions.explanation: A first DUI conviction is punishable by a fine of $500 to $1,000 (more if BAL is .15 or higher or a minor is in the car).

questions.questionText: It is illegal to park within ___ feet of the entrance to a fire, ambulance, or rescue squad station.
questions.explanation: You cannot park within 20 feet of the entrance to a fire, ambulance, or rescue squad station.

questions.questionText: A white sign with a U-turn arrow and a red circle/slash means:
questions.explanation: The red circle and slash symbol indicates the action (U-turn) is prohibited.

questions.questionText: If you are behind a motorcycle, you should allow:

answers.text: The same following distance as a car
Less following distance to see past them

questions.explanation: Motorcycles can stop quickly. Allow more following distance (4 seconds minimum) for safety.

questions.questionText: When arriving at a roundabout, you must yield to:

answers.text: No one, you have the right of way

questions.explanation: Drivers entering a roundabout must yield to traffic already circulating within the roundabout.

questions.questionText: Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit on a rural interstate highway in Florida is:
questions.explanation: The standard speed limit on rural interstate highways in Florida is 70 mph.

questions.questionText: If you are found guilty of racing on the highway, your license can be revoked for:
questions.explanation: Conviction for racing on the highway results in a mandatory license revocation for 1 year.

questions.questionText: When parking on a hill facing uphill with a curb, turn your wheels:
questions.explanation: Turn wheels away from the curb so if the car rolls back, the back of the tire hits the curb.

questions.questionText: You are driving during the day in a heavy rainstorm. You must turn on:
questions.explanation: Florida law requires headlights (low beams) to be on when it is raining, smoking, or foggy.

questions.questionText: A rectangular sign with black letters on a white background indicates:
questions.explanation: White rectangular signs with black lettering are regulatory signs (e.g., Speed Limit, No Right Turn).

questions.questionText: Passing on the right is legal when:

answers.text: There are two or more lanes of traffic moving in the same direction
The car ahead is going too slow

questions.explanation: You may pass on the right if there are two or more lanes in your direction, or the vehicle ahead is turning left.

questions.questionText: To avoid being blinded by oncoming high beams at night, you should:

answers.text: Look toward the right edge of the road

questions.explanation: Look toward the right edge of the road to avoid the glare until the vehicle passes.

questions.questionText: You are preparing to turn right at a red light. You must:

answers.text: Stop completely, yield to all traffic and pedestrians, then turn if safe
Wait for the green light regardless of traffic

questions.explanation: A complete stop is required before turning right on red. You must yield to all cross traffic and pedestrians.

questions.questionText: Florida's 'No-Fault' Law requires proof of insurance for:
questions.explanation: You must show proof of Personal Injury Protection (PIP) and Property Damage Liability (PDL) to register a vehicle.

questions.questionText: If you hit a parked car and cannot find the owner, you must:

answers.text: Leave a note with your name, address, and license plate number

questions.explanation: You must leave a note securely attached to the vehicle with your contact information and report the accident to police.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a winding arrow indicates:
questions.explanation: This sign warns that the road ahead winds with a series of turns.

questions.questionText: A flashing yellow traffic light means:

answers.text: The light is about to turn red

questions.explanation: Flashing yellow means you should slow down and proceed with caution.

questions.questionText: Unless posted otherwise, the speed limit on a 4-lane highway in Florida is:
questions.explanation: For highways that are not interstates, the standard unposted limit is typically 55 mph.

questions.questionText: Alcohol affects a driver's judgment and reaction time:
questions.explanation: Alcohol begins to affect judgment, vision, and reaction time after just one drink.

questions.questionText: A sign with a truck on a steep slope means:
questions.explanation: This warning sign indicates a steep hill or downgrade ahead.

questions.questionText: You are driving on a multi-lane highway and wish to change lanes. You must signal your intention:
questions.explanation: You must signal your intent to turn or change lanes at least 100 feet before doing so.

questions.questionText: If a law enforcement officer stops you, you should:

answers.text: Get out of the car immediately
Turn off your engine and roll down the window
Reach into the glovebox for your license before they approach
Keep driving until you find a parking lot

questions.explanation: Turn off the engine, roll down the window, and keep your hands visible on the wheel.

questions.questionText: Passing a stopped school bus with flashing red lights will result in how many points on your license?
questions.explanation: Passing a stopped school bus is a serious violation carrying 4 points.

questions.questionText: A fluorescent yellow-green sign indicates:
questions.explanation: Fluorescent yellow-green is reserved for school zones, pedestrian, and bicycle crossings.

questions.questionText: When two cars enter an open intersection at the same time, the driver on the left must yield to:
questions.explanation: At an open intersection (no signs/signals), yield to the vehicle on the right if arriving simultaneously.

questions.questionText: Hydroplaning happens when:

answers.text: Tires ride on a thin film of water
You brake too hard on dry pavement
You drive too slow in rain

questions.explanation: Hydroplaning occurs when tires lose contact with the road due to water, usually at higher speeds.

questions.questionText: You may not pass another vehicle within ___ feet of a bridge, viaduct, or tunnel.
questions.explanation: Passing is prohibited within 100 feet of bridges, viaducts, tunnels, or railroad crossings.

questions.questionText: A sign with two people walking indicates:
questions.explanation: A pentagon with two people walking marks a school crossing.

questions.questionText: If you are under 18, you cannot drive between 11 PM and 6 AM unless accompanied by a driver 21+ or:

answers.text: You are driving to or from work
You have had your license for 6 months

questions.explanation: Driving for employment purposes is an exception to the curfew for minors.

questions.questionText: Littering more than 15 pounds is considered:
questions.explanation: Littering more than 15 lbs is a first-degree misdemeanor and can result in a $1,000 fine.

questions.questionText: A vertical rectangular sign is typically:
questions.explanation: Vertical rectangles are generally regulatory signs like Speed Limit or Keep Right.

questions.questionText: Florida law requires that you dim your high beams within ___ feet of an oncoming vehicle.
questions.explanation: You must dim high beams 500 feet before meeting an oncoming vehicle.

questions.questionText: When you approach a flashing red light, you must:

answers.text: Slow down and proceed with caution
Stop only if traffic is coming
Treat it as a yield sign

questions.explanation: A flashing red light is treated the same as a stop sign.

questions.questionText: If you experience a tire blowout, do not:

answers.text: Take your foot off the gas

questions.explanation: Do not brake immediately. Grip the wheel, slow down gradually, and pull off the road.

questions.questionText: A sign with a wheelchair symbol means:
questions.explanation: This sign marks parking spaces reserved for individuals with disabilities.

questions.questionText: Driving 16 mph or more over the speed limit will result in ___ points on your license.
questions.explanation: Speeding 16 mph or more over the limit is a 4-point violation.

questions.questionText: You are approaching an intersection with a steady yellow light. You should:

answers.text: Speed up to beat the red light
Stop if you can do so safely
Continue through at the same speed
Treat it as a yield sign

questions.explanation: A steady yellow light means the light is about to turn red. Stop if you can do so safely; otherwise proceed with caution.

questions.questionText: When parking on a hill facing uphill without a curb, turn your wheels:
questions.explanation: Without a curb, turn wheels to the right so the car rolls off the road if brakes fail.

questions.questionText: Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit on a limited access highway is:
questions.explanation: Limited access highways (interstates) are typically 70 mph.

questions.questionText: Drivers entering a roundabout must yield to:
questions.explanation: Traffic inside the roundabout has the right of way.

questions.questionText: Using a cell phone while driving increases your crash risk by:
questions.explanation: Studies cited in the Florida manual indicate texting/using a phone increases crash risk by 4 times.

questions.questionText: A yellow diamond sign with a merging arrow means:

answers.text: Merging traffic entering from the right

questions.explanation: This sign warns that traffic is merging from the side.

questions.questionText: Leaving the scene of a crash involving property damage results in ___ points.
questions.explanation: Leaving the scene of an accident with property damage is a 6-point violation.

questions.questionText: When passing, you must return to the right side of the road before coming within ___ feet of an oncoming vehicle.
questions.explanation: You must complete the pass before coming within 200 feet of oncoming traffic.

questions.questionText: It is unlawful to drive at a slow speed that:

answers.text: Impedes or blocks the normal flow of traffic

questions.explanation: You cannot drive so slowly that you block or impede normal traffic flow.

questions.questionText: To prevent 'highway hypnosis', you should:

answers.text: Open the window and shift your eyes frequently

questions.explanation: Keep your eyes moving and get fresh air to avoid drowsiness.

questions.questionText: A sign with a 'T' intersection symbol means:

answers.text: The roadway ends ahead, you must turn right or left

questions.explanation: T-intersection sign warns that the road ends and you must turn.

questions.questionText: If your license is suspended for 12 points in 12 months, the suspension lasts:
questions.explanation: 12 points in 12 months results in a 30-day suspension.

questions.questionText: You may turn left on red only when:

answers.text: Turning from a one-way street onto another one-way street

questions.explanation: Left on red is only permitted when turning from a one-way street onto another one-way street.

questions.questionText: Bicyclists on the roadway are considered:

answers.text: Vehicles with the same rights and responsibilities as cars

questions.explanation: Bicycles are legally defined as vehicles in Florida and must obey traffic laws.

questions.questionText: Motorcycles are entitled to:

answers.text: The full width of a lane
Share a lane with a car

questions.explanation: Motorcycles have the right to the full width of a lane.

questions.questionText: If you are being followed too closely (tailgated), you should:

answers.text: Slow down and allow the other driver to pass

questions.explanation: Slow down gently or move to another lane to encourage the tailgater to pass.

questions.questionText: A second DUI conviction within 5 years results in a minimum imprisonment of:
questions.explanation: A second DUI within 5 years carries a mandatory 10-day jail sentence.

questions.questionText: You cannot park within ___ feet of a crosswalk at an intersection.
questions.explanation: Parking is prohibited within 20 feet of a crosswalk.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a deer symbol means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns that deer may cross the road.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to use your high beams when following another vehicle within:
questions.explanation: Dim high beams when following within 300 feet.

questions.questionText: When checking mirrors, you should also check:

answers.text: Blind spots by turning your head

questions.explanation: Mirrors don't show everything; head checks are required.

questions.questionText: If your brakes fail, you should first:
questions.explanation: Pump the brakes to build pressure. If that fails, use the parking brake slowly.

questions.questionText: The law requiring drivers to yield to funeral processions is:

answers.text: False, they must yield to traffic

questions.explanation: Florida law requires yielding to funeral processions.

questions.questionText: A brown sign indicates:
questions.explanation: Brown signs denote parks, recreation, and cultural points.

questions.questionText: A violation of the Open Container Law results in:
questions.explanation: Possession of an open container of alcohol by the driver is a moving violation carrying 3 points.

questions.questionText: Golf carts may be operated on roads only if:

answers.text: The posted speed limit is 30 mph or less

questions.explanation: Golf carts are generally limited to roads with speed limits of 30 mph or less.

questions.questionText: When towing a trailer, you must have:
questions.explanation: Safety chains are required between the vehicle and trailer.

questions.questionText: At night, if a vehicle is coming toward you with high beams on, look to:

answers.text: The right edge of your lane

questions.explanation: Look at the right edge of the lane to avoid glare.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a sharp left arrow means:
questions.explanation: Warning sign for a sharp curve to the left.

questions.questionText: Unless otherwise posted, the maximum speed limit in a residential area is:
questions.explanation: 30 mph is the default for residential/business districts.

questions.questionText: If you are caught driving with a suspended license, you may be:
questions.explanation: Driving on a suspended license is a crime punishable by jail and fines.

questions.questionText: A solid yellow line on your side of the center line means:
questions.explanation: Solid yellow line indicates no passing zone.

questions.questionText: Broken white lines separate lanes of traffic:
questions.explanation: White lines separate traffic moving in the same direction.

questions.questionText: A sign saying 'Slippery When Wet' is:
questions.explanation: This is a standard warning sign.

questions.questionText: If your vehicle skids, you should:

answers.text: Take your foot off the gas and steer in the direction of the skid
Turn the wheel opposite the skid

questions.explanation: Steer into the skid (where the rear is going) and avoid braking.

questions.questionText: You are approaching an intersection with a stop sign, but no stop line. You must stop:

answers.text: Before entering the crosswalk or intersection
In the middle of the intersection

questions.explanation: Stop before the crosswalk or intersection if no line is present.

questions.questionText: Double solid white lines mean:
questions.explanation: Double solid white lines prohibit lane changes.

questions.questionText: The fine for unlawful speeding in a school zone is:
questions.explanation: Fines are doubled in school and construction zones.

questions.questionText: When driving in fog, avoid using:
questions.explanation: High beams reflect off fog and reduce visibility.

questions.questionText: A sign indicating 'Lane Ends' means:
questions.explanation: Warning that the lane is ending and traffic must merge.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to park on the paved part of a highway:
questions.explanation: Parking on the pavement of a highway is prohibited unless the vehicle is disabled.

questions.questionText: If a driver refuses a blood alcohol test and has a prior refusal, their license is suspended for:
questions.explanation: A second refusal results in an 18-month suspension.

questions.questionText: When entering a tunnel, you should:
questions.explanation: Turn on lights to increase visibility.

questions.questionText: Drivers must yield to public transit buses:
questions.explanation: You must yield to buses signaling to re-enter traffic.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a truck rollover symbol means:
questions.explanation: Warns of rollover risk, usually on ramps.

questions.questionText: Bicyclists under the age of ___ must wear a helmet.
questions.explanation: Florida law requires helmets for riders under 16.

questions.questionText: You are involved in a minor crash with no injuries and the vehicles are movable. You must:

answers.text: Move them out of the flow of traffic
Leave them where they are for police

questions.explanation: Move vehicles off the road to prevent traffic blocking.

questions.questionText: To enter a highway from a driveway, you should:
questions.explanation: Yield to all vehicles on the main road.

questions.questionText: A sign indicating 'Reduced Speed Ahead' means:

answers.text: Slow down, lower speed limit ahead

questions.explanation: Warning that the speed limit is about to decrease.

questions.questionText: You may not coast with the transmission in neutral or the clutch disengaged while driving:
questions.explanation: Coasting downhill in neutral is illegal and dangerous.

questions.questionText: If you are convicted of DUI, your insurance costs (FR-44) will:
questions.explanation: DUI convictions require higher liability limits (100/300/50), increasing costs.

questions.questionText: When a traffic light turns green, you must:

answers.text: Yield to vehicles and pedestrians still in the intersection

questions.explanation: Green means go only if the intersection is clear.

questions.questionText: You may use a center left turn lane to:

answers.text: Make a left turn or U-turn

questions.explanation: Center lanes are for turning only, not driving or passing.

questions.questionText: If you see a flooded road ahead:

answers.text: Turn around and find another route

questions.explanation: Turn Around, Don't Drown. Water depth is deceptive.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to park on a sidewalk:
questions.explanation: Parking on sidewalks is prohibited.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a 'T' shape means:
questions.explanation: Warning for a T-intersection.

questions.questionText: Driving 50 mph or more over the speed limit incurs a fine of:
questions.explanation: Speeding 50+ over is a $1,000 fine for the first offense.

questions.questionText: If your hood flies up while driving:

answers.text: Look through the crack below the hood or out the window and pull over
Speed up to blow it down

questions.explanation: Maintain visibility and pull over safely.

questions.questionText: Carbon monoxide gas from the exhaust is:
questions.explanation: Carbon monoxide is invisible, odorless, and fatal.

questions.questionText: Headlights must be dimmed when following within ___ feet.
questions.explanation: Dim lights 300 feet when following another vehicle.
